intro: Trichocentrum allenii, commonly known as the Allen's orchid, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its long, pendant inflorescences that bear clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, utilizing its aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrients from the environment.
